result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:48 AM Defendant Briana C Scaletta in court.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant makes statements on the record. Defendant indicates she is unsure on how to resolve this matter. Defendant is seeking more time to go to the SPD office to see if she qualifies for services. 
State puts offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements.
State's Notice and Summary of Expert Testimony of Law Enforcement Officer and/or Analyst.
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce 911 Recordings.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:40 PM Defendant Briana C Scaletta appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Briana C Scaletta.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
